Commentary: length ball outside off, pushes it towards cover-point
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to King, no run

Commentary: length ball, angling on to the pads, goes for the flick but misses
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to King, no run

Commentary: a carrom ball, length outside off, stays back and hits it uppishly towards the left of mid-off. The fielder puts in the dive but it just evades him
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to King, FOUR runs

Commentary: bowled 'im! You cannot sit back to Mujeeb. Another carrom ball, length around off. Skids off the surface this time. King went back to cut but was beaten and the ball clattered into the off and middle stumps
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to King, OUT
Dismissal_text: BA King  b Mujeeb Ur Rahman 4 (4b 1x4 0x6) SR: 100.00

Commentary: fuller around off, comes forward and drives. Rashid makes the sliding stop
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Hetmyer, 1 run

Commentary: length around off, comes forward and defends
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Lewis, no run

Commentary: length ball angling in, flicked away towards mid-on
length ball around off, gets down on one knee, sweeps it towards square leg
Commentary_short: Mohammad Nabi to Lewis, no run

Commentary: fuller outside off, a touch slower in the air. Lewis pushes it towards cover-point from the crease
Commentary_short: Mohammad Nabi to Lewis, no run

Commentary: fuller outside off, seam-up one. Digs it out towards mid-off. Wanted to sneak in a single but Hetmyer sends him back
Commentary_short: Mohammad Nabi to Lewis, no run

Commentary: another seam-up one. This time on a length outside off and coming in at the batsman. Lewis gets his bat down in time
Commentary_short: Mohammad Nabi to Lewis, no run

Commentary: quicker outside off once again, pushes it towards cover from the back foot
Commentary_short: Mohammad Nabi to Lewis, no run

Commentary: fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards mid-off
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Hetmyer, no run

Commentary: length ball around off, stays back and pushes it towards cover-point
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Hetmyer, no run

Commentary: fuller but drifting down the leg side, Hetmyer goes for the flick but misses and the balls rolls past Asghar at short fine leg who puts in a slide to keep it to two
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Hetmyer, 2 leg byes

Commentary: a low full-toss on the stumps, pushed down the wicket. Mujeeb gets a hand to it and Rashid charges in from mid-off to hit the stumps direct but Hetmyer was just in. They are checking upstairs, but it's an easy decision for third umpire
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Hetmyer, 1 run

Commentary: length ball around off, comes forward and defends
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Lewis, no run

Commentary: short of length on the stumps, punches it towards long-on
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Lewis, 1 run

Commentary: short of length outside off, goes back and cuts firmly but cannot get it past the cover fielder
Commentary_short: Mohammad Nabi to Lewis, no run

Commentary: length ball on middle and leg, Lewis sweeps it behind square leg, the fielder from deep square leg puts in the chase and the slide but fails to stop
Commentary_short: Mohammad Nabi to Lewis, FOUR runs

Commentary: length ball around off, punches it towards covers
Commentary_short: Mohammad Nabi to Lewis, no run

Commentary: down the track and looks to go big, gets it from the inner half but enough on it to take it to the deep midwicket boundary
Commentary_short: Mohammad Nabi to Lewis, FOUR runs

Commentary: length ball on the stumps, punched towards mid-on for a quick single
length ball outside off, stays back and cuts it towards extra cover, straight to the fielder
Commentary_short: Mohammad Nabi to Hetmyer, no run

Commentary: short of length outside off, goes back and pulls it over midwicket
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Lewis, SIX runs

Commentary: short of length at the stumps, much quicker this time, goes back to pull but ends up chopping it into the ground
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Lewis, no run

Commentary: fuller around off, pushes it towards mid-off
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Lewis, no run

Commentary: a touch fuller around off and coming, looks to work on the leg side but ends up playing it finer than intended, towards short fine leg
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Lewis, no run

Commentary: fuller on the stumps, Lewis goes down on one knee and slog sweeps it into the stands over deep midwicket for a six
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Lewis, SIX runs

Commentary: short and wide, rocks back and smashes it between cover and extra cover to end the over with another four
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Lewis, FOUR runs

Commentary: nippy delivery on a length, coming back into him, nudged off the inside half of the bat towards mid-on. sloppy fielding means they get an over throw. An under-arm flick towards the stumps that misses and no one's backing up
hint of swing but too full, driven crisply to wide mid-off's right
slogged across the line but clears the long-on boundary. No fielder there, so it's a safe shot. Not short enough to pull, he gets it down the end of the bat and it goes very high in the air
Commentary_short: Fareed Ahmad to Lewis, SIX runs

Commentary: good comeback, a yorker on middle, dug out to mid-on for a quick single
fuller length outside off, gets nicely on the front foot and drives, but extra cover moves to his right and slides to stop it
dismissed. Cleared his front leg and whacked it straight back over the bowler. Much better connection than the first six of this over, and Evin Lewis has rocketed away
Commentary_short: Fareed Ahmad to Lewis, SIX runs

Commentary: floated up on a length on leg, tries to work it away but it trickles to midwicket off the pad
Commentary_short: Mohammad Nabi to Hetmyer, no run

Commentary: throws this wider of off and spinning away further, Hetmyer was giving himself room and has to stretch out and glide it through point
fractionally short and Lewis is on fire. The margin of error is enough for him to rock back and swivel to pull this powerfully over the deep square leg boundary
Commentary_short: Mohammad Nabi to Lewis, SIX runs

Commentary: floated up fuller and closer to off stump, he pats it down to long-off
drifts down leg and Hetmyer wants to smash a sweep shot but doesn't nail it. Complete contrast in rhythm between the two batsmen
Commentary_short: Mohammad Nabi to Hetmyer, 1 leg bye

Commentary: fires in a yorker, but Lewis goes inside out, drives it off his toes to deep cover
fifty for Lewis and it's come off just 26 balls. He goes for finesse over power this time, sweeps it fine from the leg stump and gets the timing and placement perfect to beat the man at deep square
Commentary_short: Rashid Khan to Lewis, FOUR runs

Commentary: Rashid corrects his line to bring it more middle stump and Lewis works it backward of square
that's the shot of a man feeling the pressure of not scoring. Tried to hit his way into form, ends up squirting it off an expansive drive, to deep cover
fuller on the stumps, flicked off his toes to wide long-on
was giving himself room and going back but it's a quickish slider that he ends up bunting back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, no run

Commentary: too short and Hetmyer's not going to look this gift horse in the mouth. Goes back and absolutely leathers a pull shot that clears deep midwicket comfortably. That shot will make him feel good
Commentary_short: Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, SIX runs

Commentary: clever ball first up, goes for a slower ball that's pitched back of a length. Lewis is lining up to smack it but ends up completely lost, drops his wrist and lets it go to the keeper
and back to normal service now. Another shorter ball at normal pace though, and Lewis pulls it from his chest, swivelling while connecting and sends it way over deep square leg
another slower short ball, Lewis waits for it and pulls off the bottom half of the bat to wide long-on
another slower ball, an off-cutter on a length this time going across Hetmyer, who waits for it and strokes it through extra cover
length ball, stump to stump, pushed to cover for a quick single
another slower ball, and he's a bit early into his shot, ends up checking the slap through cover to guide it to point's left
lovely ball and huge appeal by Rashid but the umpire reckons there was an inside edge. drifted and dipped, then spun past his bat to hit pad while he was trying to prod forward
Commentary_short: Rashid Khan to Lewis, no run

Commentary: shows the full face of the bat to punch it down the ground very straight
goes down on one knee to sweep it hard, but there's a sweeper in place at deep midwicket
beaten him that time. Hetmyer was giving himself room but Rashid sent this in quicker and he misses the flick off the back foot
Commentary_short: Rashid Khan to Hetmyer, no run

Commentary: got him this time. Might have been a wrong 'un, though Rashid tends to bowl his leggies without too much change of action. Was very full and Hetmyer went for the big slog sweep, ends up edging it onto pad and it loops up for the keeper to come forward and take the catch
Dismissal_text: SO Hetmyer c †Rahmanullah Gurbaz b Rashid Khan 21 (21b 0x4 1x6) SR: 100.00

Commentary: length outside off, nudged to long-on
length ball nipping back in, steered to short third man
good length going across the left-hander, who stays inside the line and punches through cover
slower bouncer once again, doesn't get hold of the pull, it comes off the toe end but travels flatter and bounces well in front of long-on
another slower one, this time he waits for it and drives firmly to mid-off, who has a shy as they take a risky single. Results in an extra run. If Rashid at mid-off had hit, Lewis would have been out
length ball angling into him, nurdled to fine-leg
good ball, well wide of off stump but inside the tram line and bowled back of a length. He has to reach out for it and doesn't connect
length ball on the stumps, paddled through square

nicely mixed up the pace there, went right through Lewis. Length ball from wide of the crease around the stumps, coming in with the angle and Lewis is completely foxed as he tries to steer to third man but doesn't connect
Commentary_short: Gulbadin Naib to Lewis, no run

Commentary: Lewis tries to counter the line by moving well across and outside off. Tries to send it to Kanpur from Lucknow with an almighty swing of the bat, but doesn't connect
Commentary_short: Gulbadin Naib to Lewis, no run

Commentary: Naib has earned that wicket. Frustrated Lewis into mis-hitting that one after a succession of balls that the batsman didn't even connect with. This one was a mite shorter and Lewis wanted to pull that into oblivion, but ends up getting a top edge that settles comfortably into long-off's hands
Dismissal_text: E Lewis c Mohammad Nabi b Gulbadin Naib 68 (41b 4x4 6x6) SR: 165.85

Commentary: good length in the channel, jabbed towards point
Commentary_short: Gulbadin Naib to Ramdin, no run

Commentary: slower ball, a bit short, he waits for it and pulls to deep square leg
short outside off, but quicker, tapped to long-on
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Ramdin, 1 run

Commentary: fuller outside off, he lunges for it and opens the face to send it to point
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Pollard, 1 run

Commentary: back of a length, but Ramdin doesn't seem to be reading the turn, he's playing it off the pitch, and swats it to short fine leg
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Ramdin, 1 run

Commentary: fuller, almost yorker length on leg stump, hits the pad and goes to fine leg. Big appeal but that was going down
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Pollard, 1 leg bye

Commentary: goes back and punches this to cover
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Ramdin, 1 run

Commentary: skids on and almost catches him in front, but he manages to get the bat down in time to jab it into the offside
Commentary_short: Mujeeb Ur Rahman to Pollard, no run

Commentary: pulled to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, slashed to point and they take the single. Direct hit, but Pollard is well in at the striker's end
back of a length and nipping into him, tries to flick it off his thigh pad but doesn't connect
Commentary_short: Gulbadin Naib to Pollard, no run

Commentary: slower ball, length on leg stump, nurdled to backward square leg off his pads
length outside off, glides it to point. No run
Commentary_short: Gulbadin Naib to Ramdin, no run

Commentary: another slower ball, he has to wait for it and ends up pushing it into the offside
beauty. It's the Rashid Khan special that has the batsman poking outside off but not connecting with ball
Commentary_short: Rashid Khan to Ramdin, no run

Commentary: slog-swept and slog-swept well. The line is a bit more middle stump, and the length is a bit fuller, which allows him to go down on one knee and nail the shot
Commentary_short: Rashid Khan to Ramdin, SIX runs

Commentary: tapped off the back foot to long-on
length on off, Pollard lunges and pushes it to the bowler's left
Commentary_short: Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run

Commentary: outside edge goes fine but short third man makes a good stop by tumbling and diving. Pollard pushing forward again but this turns more than he though and takes the edge
length ball on the stumps, punched through cover
giving himself room to flay it through the offside but gets an under edge that bounces to the keeper. Just misses the stumps too
Commentary_short: Gulbadin Naib to Ramdin, no run

Commentary: knocked him over. Floated up a slower ball yorker and Ramdin is way too early into his slog sweep. The ball sneaks under his bat and shatters stumps
Dismissal_text: D Ramdin  b Gulbadin Naib 20 (19b 0x4 1x6) SR: 105.26

Commentary: smoked>. What a shot, first ball. Full on off stump and he leans into a peachy straight drive that's Rolls Roycing its way to the boundary
Commentary_short: Gulbadin Naib to Rutherford, FOUR runs

Commentary: worked off his pads backward of square
length well outside off, steered to backward point who makes a mess of it. Slides and it pings off his body towards extra cover, which gives them an extra run
slower ball on off, he waits for it and taps it with soft hands to midwicket. The man is deep so they can run two
length on the stumps, he goes right back and flicks it off his pads to short fine leg
fuller, flicked off his toes to deep midwicket
plays the pick-up shot to this fuller one, but doesn't get hold of it completely. Picked his spot well though, in the gap between long-on and deep midwicket, so it lands safe
pushes gently into the offside for a quick single
tight line on a length and Pollard shows the full face of the bat in his front-foot defence
Commentary_short: Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run

Commentary: length on the stumps, he goes back and works it to deep midwicket
tried to dig it into the pitch but it just sat up and Pollard waited for it and whacked it powerfully to the deep square leg boundary
bowls the bouncer quicker that time, but Pollard is equal to it and pulls to deep midwicket. There's a fielder there to clean up

got 'im!. Saw the batsman giving him the charged and bowled the offcutter, while also pulling his length back. The ball sneaks into the rather large gap left with Rutherford attempting to swing for the fences, and knocks over the stumps
pacy one, length outside off, and Allen is late on the attempted cut
too far outside off and he'll have to rebowl that
slower ball now, angling into him, and Allen not able to read it, ends up pushing to cover
length on the stumps, clipped through midwicket
well bowled, slower and well wide of off. He ends up off-balance while trying to smash it through the offside. Doesn't connect. That came out of the back of the hand
Commentary_short: Gulbadin Naib to Allen, no run

Commentary: throws the kitchen sink at that one, similar line and length well outside off but he goes towards the ball that time and gets a goodish bit on it. One bounce to deep point
slower ball on the stumps, Pollard's too early into the drive and mis-times it totally. Goes off the inside half but very straight and in no man's land. Long on runs around and fields
throws his bat at it again, trying to pull it through midwicket. Ends up getting it off the toe end and straighter. The dew is evident in how Afghanistan are sliding to stop the ball
slower ball again outside off this time. Better connection but straight to long-off

slower ball and he mis-times it, goes in the air but lands short of deep midwicket. Was clearing his leg to give himself room but Naib has had some wonderful changes of pace that no West Indies batsman has mastered. Ends a fine spell
going across him, took the pace off. Pollard had cleared his leg and was almost front on, wanted to really whack that. Doesn't connect
short ball, slower again, he pulls to square leg. Bowler and batsmen are having a lot of mutterings to each other, covering their mouths too.
length ball around off, smashes it but straight towards the extra cover fielder

a low full toss on the pads from around the wicket, Pollard flicks it towards deep midwicket and hares back for the second. The throw is a bit wide, the keeper gathers and flicks but misses the stumps
slower bouncer outside off, but Pollard moves across and tonks it way over deep midwicket for a six
fuller and wider and smashes passed the diving mid-off. West Indies finish with a six and a four off the last two balls
back of a length and some movement away straight up, punches it to point backward point
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Hazratullah Zazai, no run

Commentary: late on the flick, this one comes in with the angle and flies to point off his pad
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Hazratullah Zazai, no run

Commentary: he's moving the ball this way and that. This one was outside off and nipping away, Zazai tried to slog it with feet static, doesn't connect
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Hazratullah Zazai, no run

Commentary: closer to his body this time and he pulls it to deep midwicket
length on the fourth stump, pushed to mid-off. He was looking to give himself room so ended up pushing at it with bat away from body
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Hazratullah Zazai, no run

Commentary: goes for the yorker but not full enough, flicked off his pads to deep midwicket
good length going across him, ends up feeling for it and it passes the outside edge
Commentary_short: Holder to Hazratullah Zazai, no run

Commentary: leading edge just clears point. Zazai had no clue about that, early into the shot, trying to turn it to the legside and ball flies off the leading edge. Fortunate that it didn't go to hand
straight into short fine leg's hands. Moves across his stumps to flick this length ball fine, but gets the placement and control horribly wrong. He's distraught but has to go
Dismissal_text: Rahmanullah Gurbaz c King b Holder 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

Commentary: length outside off, defended carefully back to the bowler
Commentary_short: Holder to Ibrahim Zadran, no run

Commentary: outside edge, falls just short of the slip fielder. Length outside off, took the shoulder of the bat, but he played it with soft hands too
Commentary_short: Holder to Ibrahim Zadran, no run

Commentary: shot. Goes on the front foot and lofts his cover drive over the in-field. The dew means the ball slows up enough for the fielders to hare after it and pull it back before the boundary
length on the stumps, tucked off his thigh pad to deep square

not a debut to remember for the youngster, who goes to pull this back of a length ball outside off, but is undone by the ball getting bigger on him than he though, ends up spooning a simple catch to midwicket, with the ball going straight up in the air
Dismissal_text: Ibrahim Zadran c Allen b Cottrell 2 (4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00

Commentary: fuller on middle and leg, he misses the flick
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Hazratullah Zazai, no run

Commentary: strays down leg and flicks the thigh pad to go very fine, beats the fielder to trickle to the boundary
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Hazratullah Zazai, 4 leg byes

Commentary: fuller, tapped towards midwicket with soft hands. They take a quick single
length outside off, driven on the up to cover
Commentary_short: Cottrell to Asghar Afghan, no run

Commentary: slapped to mid-off. He's not got his timing right so far today
Commentary_short: Holder to Hazratullah Zazai, no run

Commentary: that's well played in the end. Back of a length on leg stump, he wasn't perfectly in position but ends up tucking it very fine while on the move and gets it to the boundary
Commentary_short: Holder to Hazratullah Zazai, FOUR runs

Commentary: fuller, driven to extra cover but Holder has overstepped.
Commentary_short: Holder to Hazratullah Zazai, 1 no ball

Commentary: nicely done, yorker on off stump. He was clearing his front foot but ends up squirting it towards square leg off the inside edge

walloped Asghar has spent a fair bit of time in the middle without getting the strike, and he has sussed the pace of the pitch and bowler. He saw this pitched short, rocked back and sent it over deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Holder to Asghar Afghan, SIX runs

Commentary: fuller on the stumps, flicked straight. There is a short mid-on in place who fields
Commentary_short: Holder to Asghar Afghan, no run

Commentary: length on the stumps, tucked backwards of square
smacked. Too short once again and he's in a mood to punish those. Rocks back and pulls this to deep square leg's left
Commentary_short: Williams to Asghar Afghan, FOUR runs

Commentary: length on the stumps, moves inside the line and tucks it to square leg
length on the stumps, nudged to midwicket, going half-forward
yorker on the stumps, flicked to short fine leg. Williams thought it was pad first, but there was some bat on it
inside edge misses leg stump. Zazai's not one to move his feet much, and this time too they stay static as he tries to push this through the offside. takes the inside edge and goes to fine leg
slower bouncer, he's late in adjusting and can't get bat on it. Goes through to the keeper
Commentary_short: Williams to Asghar Afghan, no run

Commentary: a brilliant yorker at the stumps, Zazai jams his bat at it to work it in front of square leg, puts in the dive to make it for the second run
short of length around off, jumps in the air and drops it towards extra cover
excellent yorker once again, looks to clear his leg and swipe it on the leg side but misses. The ball rolls towards short fine leg off the pad
Commentary_short: Holder to Asghar Afghan, no run

Commentary: loses his radar completely there. Is that dew? Ends up bowling full and way down the leg side
short of length aimed at the batsman, Asghar pulls it down towards deep square leg
slower length ball around off, pushes it towards point
Commentary_short: Holder to Hazratullah Zazai, no run

Commentary: another bouncer to end the over with, Zazai ducks under and has a smile on his face afterwards
Commentary_short: Holder to Hazratullah Zazai, no run

Commentary: slower length ball around off, Asghar had to defend in the end
Commentary_short: Pollard to Asghar Afghan, no run

Commentary: short of length outside off, rocks back and pulls it hard towards deep midwicket. Fabian Allen was quick to the ball but looks he has hurt his knee there
slower length ball outside off, cuts it towards extra cover where Keemo Paul makes an excellent stop diving to his right
goes for the yorker this time, just outside off, Asghar takes it on the full and works it towards the long-on's right
slower, fuller and wider. Zazai fails to connect, and is looking at the umpire expecting a wide. Not to be. A close call
Commentary_short: Pollard to Hazratullah Zazai, no run

Commentary: length outside off, taps it towards cover for one
Commentary_short: Pollard to Hazratullah Zazai, no run

Commentary: short of length around off, pulled towards deep square leg
length but way too outside off. Needs to be bowled again
short and wide and Zazai finds the gap with the cut. Sweeper cover cannot stop it. A welcome boundary with the required rate almost touching ten
Commentary_short: Rutherford to Hazratullah Zazai, FOUR runs

Commentary: length, goes for the offcutter but way too wide. Zazai cannot reach there
short at the stumps this time, pulls it towards deep square leg
an attempted bouncer, Asghar goes back and looks to hook. Gets a top edge over short fine leg for four. Fifty is up with that boundary
Commentary_short: Rutherford to Asghar Afghan, FOUR runs

Commentary: length ball on the stumps, goes deep and pulls it towards deep midwicket. Not the best of the timings
length ball around off, cuts it towards covers but a brilliant stop there keeps it to one
fuller outside off, looks to smash it over wide long-on but Williams has rolled his fingers over it, a faint edge and an easy catch for the keeper
Dismissal_text: Hazratullah Zazai c †Ramdin b Williams 23 (29b 2x4 0x6) SR: 79.31

Commentary: slower one again, fuller around off, drops it one the off side. Looks for a non-existent single but sent back
Commentary_short: Williams to Najibullah Zadran, no run

Commentary: length ball around off, stays back and dabs it towards short third man, gets the single this time
fuller on the stumps, Asghar looks to flick but misses. An appeal for lbw but was heading down
Commentary_short: Williams to Asghar Afghan, no run

Commentary: short of length outside off, goes back and pulls it towards long-on
slower length ball but way down the leg side
length ball outside off, dabs it towards short third man but no single this time
Commentary_short: Williams to Najibullah Zadran, no run

Commentary: starts with a short one around off, cuts it towards extra cover
short of length on the stumps, pulls it towards deep midwicket
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
flatter around off, waits for it to spin in and opens the face of the bat to guide it towards short third man. No run though
Commentary_short: Walsh to Najibullah Zadran, no run

Commentary: short again, Najib rocks back and pulls it in front of deep square leg
Commentary_short: Walsh to Najibullah Zadran, FOUR runs

Commentary: short of length once more, pulled away hard and fine this time, bounces just inside the fine leg boundary
Commentary_short: Walsh to Najibullah Zadran, FOUR runs

Commentary: slower length ball, pulled away towards deep square leg, in the air. And a brilliant catch by Keemo Paul, coming in and diving forward, or is it? Paul is not sure even though Pollard is celebrating. The umpires are checking upstairs. The question is did he get his fingers under it. It's not very clear though. The soft signal was out, and it stays out as there is no conclusive evidence that the ball hit the turf
Dismissal_text: Asghar Afghan c sub (KMA Paul) b Pollard 25 (21b 2x4 1x6) SR: 119.04

Commentary: slower length ball around off, drops it towards point for a quick single
fuller on the pads, glanced towards fine leg to get off the mark
length ball on the stumps, swatted towards deep square leg
short of length down the leg side, helped towards fine leg
short of length around off, punched towards short cover
Commentary_short: Pollard to Najibullah Zadran, no run

Commentary: length ball down the leg side, called a wide
length outside off, chops it towards backward point
Commentary_short: Rutherford to Mohammad Nabi, no run

Commentary: short of length outside off, come room this time, Nabi cuts it in front of backward point
short of length outside off, goes for the cut but misses
Commentary_short: Rutherford to Najibullah Zadran, no run

Commentary: goes for the slower bouncer outside off, looks to pull it down but misses
Commentary_short: Rutherford to Najibullah Zadran, no run

Commentary: short of length outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover
slower length ball on the pads, flicked away towards fine leg
short of length at the batsman, Nabi backs away and pulls it towards deep square leg
an appeal for lbw but that was pitching outside the leg stump. A touch fuller and angling across, Najib was looking to flick it on the leg side but misses
a low full toss on the stumps, Nabi was moving across and manages to flick it in front of square leg
fuller outside off and Najib squeezes it behind point, the sweeper cover cannot get to it in time
Commentary_short: Holder to Najibullah Zadran, FOUR runs

Commentary: length ball angling in, Najib misses the flick once again but it was pitching outside the leg stump once again
Commentary_short: Holder to Najibullah Zadran, no run

Commentary: short of length, rising towards the rib cage, dabs it towards backward square leg
slower length ball outside off, Najib is early into the cut, tries to adjust but too late and is beaten
Commentary_short: Pollard to Najibullah Zadran, no run

Commentary: fuller outside off, looks to drive through covers but get it from the inner half of the bat. The ball rolls towards the bowler
Commentary_short: Pollard to Najibullah Zadran, no run

Commentary: floated full outside off but too wide, Najib lets it go through. Needs to bowled again
short of length outside off, looks to pull down the ground but gets it low on the bat. Long-off slides across to make the stop
made that sweet sound off the bat. Was a length ball outside off, a slower one as well. Najib just dispatches it over deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Pollard to Najibullah Zadran, SIX runs

Commentary: fuller outside off, slower again. Najib looks to smash it over the bowler's head but gets it from the bottom of the bat and ends up skying it towards the keeper. Miles in the air and Ramdin settles under it, pouches while tumbling to his right
Dismissal_text: Najibullah Zadran c †Ramdin b Pollard 27 (22b 3x4 1x6) SR: 122.72
